thread.title: 5th ODI: South Africa going strong despite losing Amla early
thread.title_full: 5th ODI: South Africa going strong despite losing Amla early

title: 5th ODI: South Africa going strong despite losing Amla early
text:
South Africa made two changes in their playing XI. Dean Elgar and Kyle Abbott come in place of Chris Morris and Aaron Phangiso. 
India go into the final match with the same squad that played in the fourth ODI. 
This is Rohit Sharma's first ODI at Wankhede, though he has played Test match here. 
SA lose Hashim Amla cheaply 
Proteas lost their opener Hashim Amla (23 off 13 balls) pretty early who was caught behind the stumps by MS Dhoni off Mohit Sharma's delivery. However, in form Quinton deCock is going strongly against Indian bowlers. 
Teams: 
India: Rohit Sharma, Shikhar Dhawan, Virat Kohli, Mahendra Singh Dhoni (captain), Suresh Raina, Ajinkya Rahane, Axar Patel, Bhuvneshwar Kumar, Harbhajan Singh, Mohit Sharma, Amit Mishra. 
South Africa: Quinton de Kock, David Miller, Hashim Amla, Faf du Plessis, AB de Villiers (captain), Farhaan Behardien, Dale Steyn, Kagiso Rabada, Imran Tahir, Dean Elgar, Kyle Abbott. Read more about:
